summary: front dashboard is sticky, cracked, and peeling off as well as the front and back door panels.

The contact owned a 2008 Lexus IS350. The contact stated while driving approximately 15 mph, the steering wheel began to turn to the left independently and crashed into a parked vehicle. The contact’s vehicle rolled over and landed on its roof before stopping. None of the air bags deploy upon impact. A bystander assisted the contact to exit the vehicle by breaking the front passenger side window with his foot. The contact was transported to the hospital by ambulance. The contact sustained bruising on her face and body. A police report was filed. The vehicle was towed to the insurance company lot and deemed totaled by the insurance company. The manufacturer was not made aware of the failure. Prior to the failure, the vehicle was serviced for the air bags recall however, the dealer only replaced the passenger’s side air bag inflator and used masking tape for the engine hoses. The failure mileage was approximately 95,000.

The dash is melting and is extremely sticky. On sunny days, the sunlight reflects off of the dash and onto the windshield obstructing the driver's view. In addition, anything that gets on the dash sticks and cannot be removed. This debris also reflects on the windshield causing issues with visibility.  I have contacted Lexus directly and have been told they will not repair or replace the dash because this was only a TSB and my car is now beyond the term for the TSB. This is something that should be a recall because it prevents the driver from being able to see what is happening in front of the vehicle and could cause an accident.

Electrical Issues started at approximately 30,000 miles. Random times of power windows not rolling down or back up. Random times of Radio controls not working. After recall of airbags was completed, the Navigation system started having Random issues with the touchscreen. Sometimes it would work and sometimes it didn't. Eventually the touchscreen on the Navigation quit working at all.  When the door panels were replaced,  the windows started working more consistently. The Air Conditioner stopped working one day. The next day after driving it back into the driveway,  over the driveway bump,  it started working.  The entire electrical system seems like there are wires that make a connection,  then maybe come loose just barely enough to no longer make a connection.  And just a mechanic's hand brushing against something during a normal maintenance check up fixes it temporarily. Or hitting a bump in the road.  Every issue is ELECTRICAL related.  There are many other IS250 owners with the same issues all over public forums online.  Many too that their Navigation no longer worked after few miles on the car.  Could these electrical issues cause a fire? How do we know it can't? It's always a worry when I drive my car.
Airbag light keeps going on and off. Looked up on google. A lot of people are having this issue. I filed for a complaint before and got no response.
Melted dash board
Extremely terrible material used on the dash and door panels. Sticky black material sticking to my children and their clothes.

The wiring harness for the front passenger airbag was recalled by lexus because it is too short and frequently becomes disconnected which disables the front passenger airbag and cause the air bag light to turn on on the instrument panel. Lexus sent a letter informing me of the recall, but it was sent to my parents house and I did not receive it in time. After finding the recall letter, the pandemic also prevented me from making it to the dealership in time. The letter they sent me also had no markings to indicate it was a recall or that the information inside was important in any way so the letter was easily ignored. I spoke with a lexus dealership and lexus corporate and they both refused to perform the safety repair because I was about 2 to 3 months past their deadline (June 2020?). As a result, my front passenger air bag is inoperable and any front riding passenger in my vehicle is at a greatly increased safety risk in the event of a serious crash. Lexus admitted the problem with their wiring harness and instituted a recall, so I don't think it is fair for them to potentially sacrifice the lives and the safety of my front riding passengers because of a superficial deadline. I would appreciate any help you could provide in convincing lexus to honor their safety recall for my vehicle. Thank you.

THIS VEHICLE HAS AN OIL CONSUMPTION PROBLEM THE SAME AS OTHER TOYOTA VEHICLES IN THE CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT RELATING TO OWNERS HAVING TO CONSTANTLY SPEND MONEY ON OIL DUE TO A DEFECT IN THE ENGINE. THIS TOYOTA/LEXUS ENGINE DEFECT CONSUMES OIL AND THIS PROBLEM GROWS WORST AS THE VEHICLES GET OLDER. TOYOTA KNEW OF THIS ISSUE BUT DID NOT INFORM CUSTOMERS, AND WILL NOT HELP IN THE REPAIR OR DO A RECALL. THIS PROBLEM CAN CAUSE THE ENGINE TO FAIL AND CAUSE A HOST OF OTHER ISSUES.

MY ISSUE PERTAINS TO THE STICKY DASH AND THE SAME MATERIALS USED ON PARTS OF THE DOOR NEAR THE HANDLES. WHEN THE TEMPERATURE GETS OVER 80 DEGREES THE MATERIAL STARTS TO MELT AND BECOMES EXTREME HOT AND STICKY. WHEN I TRIED TO GRAB PAPERS I LEFT ON THE DASH I HAD TO TEAR THEM OFF AND IT LEFT A STICKY SUBSTANCE. IT ALSO CAN BECOME EXTREMELY HOT AND WHEN I HIT ANY PART OF THE DASH WHEN HEATED IT BURNS AND STICKS TO ME. I ATTEMPTED TO CONTACT LEXUS AND THEY DECLINED MY CLAIM BECAUSE IT IS NOT A 'SAFETY ISSUE TO THEM OR THE NHTSA'

IF I GET IN A WRECK, IT WILL BE 100% ON LEXUS!

THE CAR HAS EXTREMELY HIGH OIL CONSUMPTION. THE CYLINDER WALLS HAVE APPARENTLY PREMATURELY WORN DOWN DESPITE TIMELY OIL CHANGES AND MAINTENANCE. I AM HAVING TO PUT 2 QUARTS OF OIL FOR EVERY 1,000 MILES AT THIS POINT.
DASHBOARD MELTING AND STICKY. DASHBOARD LEAVES GLARE WHEN PARKED OR DRIVING DURING DAY/HOT WEATHER. CONTACTED DEALER, DEALER SAID CANT DO ANYTHING FOR ME. MELTING STICKY DASHBOARD CREATES ODOR.

2008 LEXUS IS 250 EXHIBITS A BRIEF RATTLE NOISE (APPROXIMATELY 1-3 SECONDS) AT START-UP. THE ISSUE WAS DIAGNOSED BY A LEXUS DEALERSHIP WHICH RECOMMENDED REPLACING THE CAM GEAR ASSEMBLY ASSOCIATED WITH THE VARIABLE VALVE TIMING (VVT) SYSTEM. THE VVT GEAR HOUSING AND SPROCKET COULD SEPARATE AND RESULT IN THE ENGINE STOPPING WHILE THE VEHICLE IS BEING DRIVEN, INCREASING THE RISK OF A CRASH.    THE SAME SYMPTOMS, DIAGNOSIS, AND RECOMMENDED REPAIR WERE SUBJECT OF THE TOYOTA SAFETY RECALL 13V-395. THE RECALL EXCLUDED THE 2008 LEXUS IS 250, HOWEVER INCLUDED THE 2006-2011 LEXUS IS 350, 2010-2011 LEXUS IS 350C, AND THE 2006-2011 GS 350 MODELS.    THE SAME DIAGNOSIS AND RECOMMENDED REPAIR WAS DETERMINED TO BE A SAFETY ISSUE IN THE MODELS ABOVE, BUT IS NOT IN THE 2008 LEXUS IS 250?
CAR SHAKES WHEN STOPPED, HESITATION WHEN PRESSING GAS PEDAL

THE DASHBOARD MELTING WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION AND STATIONARY. MELTING DASHBOARD CREATES A GLARE IN THE WINDSHIELD AND MAKES IT IMPOSSIBLE TO SEE WHEN DRIVING DURING THE DAY. ADDITIONALLY, TOXIC FUMES FROM MELTING DASHBOARD MAKE IT DIFFICULT TO BREATHE WHEN DRIVING.  *TR

EVER SINCE I HAD THIS CAR, I ALWAYS HAD THE CONSTANT PROBLEM OF A WEIRD ENGINE SMELL OF ROTTEN EGGS, IT OVERHEATS OUT OF NOWHERE CONSTANTLY AFTER MULTIPLE REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE PAID OUT OF POCKET. IT WOULD SHUT OFF WHILE DRIVING ANYWHERE. THESE ARE JUST SOME OF THE RECEIPTS.  *TR

TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN. WITHIN THE IS-F(2008-2014). MEMBERS ARE EXPERIENCING CRACKED HEADERS MANIFOLD. MEMBERS REPORT SMELLING BAD EGGY PRE-CAT FUMES ODOR. THIS SEEMS TO BE AN ISSUE FOR PEOPLE WITH MID TO HIGH MILEAGE. THE OTHER ISSUE EVERY MEMBER IS EXPERIENCING ARE LEAKING VALLEY PLATE SEAL. PINK COOLANT CAN BE OBSERVED DRIPPING IN MINOR CASES AND LEAKING IN MAJOR CASES. CASES OF A POOL OF COOLANT ON OWNERS DRIVEWAY/GARAGES. THIS CAN EASILY CAUSE A FIRE.
VALLEY PLATE LEAK

LEXUS ISF, YEAR MODELS 2008-2014, ARE AFFECTED BY A VALLEY PLATE LEAK DUE TO THE FACT THAT TOYOTA/LEXUS UTILIZED THE IMPROPER SEALANT AND USED THE IMPROPER AMOUNT, LEADING TO THE HEAT EXCHANGER LEAKING COOLANT ONCE THE ORIGINAL, INADEQUATE SEALANT BEGINS TO DISINTEGRATE. THIS COULD CAUSE A CONDITION WHERE THE ENGINE COULD FAIL AND SOMEONE COULD GET HURT. THIS ISSUE IS VERY PROMINENT IN THE COMMUNITY (EVERY LEXUS FACEBOOK GROUP AND FORUM HAS DOCUMENTED THIS INFORMATION) - MOST ISFS DEVELOP THIS UNDER 100K MILES.     FURTHERMORE, ALL ISFS WILL EVENTUALLY HAVE A CRACKED RH MANIFOLD ON THE #8 RUNNER. THIS CAN CAUSE A FIRE HAZARD IN ADDITION TO CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING.    MY 2008 ISF HAS BEEN LEAKING COOLANT FOR ABOUT 15K MILES, PROGRESSIVELY GETTING WORSE (INSPECTED EVERY OIL CHANGE). IN ADDITION, I HAVE TO START TOPPING OF THE COOLANT EVERY WEEK. LEXUS DEALER QUOTED THIS REPAIR AT ALMOST $2000.  *TR

PER THE FORUMS AND USED FB GROUPS, ALL ISFS YEAR MODELS 2008-2014 ARE AFFECTED THE VALLEY PLATE LEAK DUE TO THE FACT THAT TOYOTA/LEXUS UTILIZED THE IMPROPER SEALANT AND USED THE IMPROPER AMOUNT, LEADING TO THE HEAT EXCHANGER LEAKING COOLANT ONCE THE ORIGINAL, INADEQUATE SEALANT BEGINS TO DISINTEGRATE. THIS COULD CAUSE A CONDITION WHERE THE ENGINE COULD FAIL AND SOMEONE COULD GET HURT.  FURTHERMORE, ALL ISFS WILL EVENTUALLY HAVE A CRACKED RH MANIFOLD ON THE #8 RUNNER. THIS CAN CAUSE A FIRE HAZARD IN ADDITION TO CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING.    I PERSONALLY HAD THIS ISSUE ON MY 2008 AND KNOW AT LEAST 100 OWNERS WHO HAVE ALSO HAD THIS ISSUE FIXED. I AM SURE MANY MORE ARE OUT THERE.  *TR

MY LEXUS ISF HAS A CRACKED PASSENGER SIDE MANIFOLD WHICH IS VERY AUDIBLE ON STARTUP AND BEGINNING SIGNS OF A VALLEY PLATE COOLANT LEAK, WHICH WILL EVENTUALLYLEAD TO ENGINE FAILURE. THESE CARS WERE MADE IN VERY LOW NUMBERS, HOWEVER  OUR CAR ENTHUSIAST COMMUNITY IS EXPERIENCING THESE FAILURES IN A HIGHER THAN ACCEPTABLE NUMBERS OF THIS RARE VEHICLE. EACH REPAIR IS MANY THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS AND (VALLEY PLATE 2K-5K) (MANIFOLD QUOTED AT 22 HOURS LABOR AND 1400 FOR THE PART FROM LEXUS) TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT THE LOW PRODUCTION NUMBER AND HIGH RATE OF FAILURE, THIS MUST BE ADDRESSED. LEXUS HAS FAILED TO WORK WITH ME SHARING THE BILL.

IT IS KNOWN AS THE VALLEY PLATE LEAK. AND IT'S RADIATOR FLUID LEAKING OUT WHICH CAUSES DAMAGE TO THE COMPRESSION AND ALSO CAUSES THE VEHICLE TO OVER HEAT EASILY. IT HAPPENED WHEN I LET THE CAR SIT AND STARTED IT AND I NOTICED THE VALLEY PLATE STARTED LEAKING.

SUNROOF GLASS EXPLODED FOR NO REASON, SENDING GLASS PARTICLES INSIDE THE CAR WHILE TRANSPORTING MY INFANT DAUGHTER AND DRIVING.  IT IS A MIRACLE NOBODY GOT HURT.  THERE IS DOCUMENTED CASES OF SUNROOF GLASS EXPLODING ON LEXUS CARS CLASS ACTION LAWSUITS.  MY CAR HAS BEEN AT THE DEALER BY REQUEST OF LEXUS USA REPRESENTATIVE SCOTT MURPHY SINCE LAST FRIDAY 11/15 AND STILL NO RESOLUTION.  THE SAFETY OF VEHICLE OWNERS SHOULD NOT BE BARGAINING CHIP.  THESE EXPLOSION CAN CAUSE SERIOUS DAMAGE TO VEHICLE OPERATOR AND OCCUPANTS.

OVER TIME, THE REARVIEW MIRROR HAS DARKENED WITH BLACK SPOTS AND LINES MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO SEE DURING THE DAY.  LEXUS IS AWARE OF THE PROBLEM, BUT WILL NOT REPLACE THE MIRROR WITHOUT A RECALL.  THE DEFECT CAN BE SEEN ON REARVIEW MIRRORS FOR SALE ON EBAY.  I WAS ADVISED BY LEXUS SERVICE THAT IF IT DOESN'T PASS SAFETY CHECK INSPECTION TO STICK ON A TEMPORARY MIRROR.  THEY KNOW THERE IS A PROBLEM AND IT IS A SAFETY ISSUE.  THERE MUST BE A RECALL BEFORE SOMEONE DIES.  I FIND MYSELF LOOKING LONGER INTO THE MIRROR, TAKING MY EYES OFF THE ROAD, TO DISCERN THE TRAFFIC BEHIND.    I TOOK PICTURES, BUT ON EBAY, IF YOU LOOK CLOSE, YOU CAN SEE THE SPOTTING AND LINES ON THE USED MIRRORS FOR SALE.  IT'S NOT AN ISOLATED INCIDENT.  ESPECIALLY BY THE COMPASS IN THE RIGHT HAND SIDE THERE ARE NOTICEABLE PARALLEL DIAGONAL LINES.  THE REST OF THE MIRROR IS SPOTTY WITH LINES AND DARK.

IT NOW NO LONGER WORKS AT ALL, AND THE ONLY WAY TO STEER IT IS WITH MANUAL (VERY HEAVY) STEERING.  IT HAS BEEN SITTING IN THE DRIVEWAY FOR THE PAST 3 WEEKS.

I BOUGHT 2008 LEXUS IS250 WITH 123K MILES ON 05/18/19. I HAD INSPECTED BY A MECHANIC PRIOR TO PURCHASING IT. ON ONE OCASSION PROR TO ACCIDENT, I BACKED OUT OF A DRIVE WAY. WHEN I SHIFTED THE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FROM REVERSE TO DRIVE IT SUDDEN ACCELERATED FOR A BRIEF MOMENT, BUT IT WAS CLEAR IN FRONT OF ME AND I REMAIN IN CONTROL. IT ONLY HAPPENED TO ME THAT ONE TIME THAT WEEK AND I THOUGHT NOTHING OF IT. IN THE MORNING OF MAY 29, 2019 THE CAR WAS PARALLEL PARKED WITH A VEHICLE BOTH IN FRONT BEHIND IT. MY WIFE SLOWLY BACK UP THE CAR TO ALLOW ROOM TO PULL OUT OF THE PARKING SPOT. SHE TURN THE FRONT WHEELS TOWARDS THE CURB SO THAT THE FRONT OF THE CAR WOULD SLIGHTLY STICK OUT. WHEN SHE SHIFTED THE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FROM REVERSE TO DRIVE, THE CAR SUDDENLY ACCELERATED, JUMP OVER THE CURB AND HIT THE CONCRETE WALL OF A SCHOOL. SHE PANICKED AT THE SUDDEN ACCELERATION AND DOES NOT REMEMBER IF SHE STEP ON ANY PEDAL DURING THAT TIME. SHE ONLY KNOWS IT ACCELERATED AS SOON AS SHE SHIFTED TO DRIVE AND THEN THE CAR HIT THE WALL. THERE WERE NO INJURIES AND NO OTHER CAR WAS INVOLVED. WE MOVED THE CAR OFF THE SIDE WALK AND NOTIFIED THE INSURANCE AND THE SCHOOL ADMIN.THE INSURANCE DECLARED IT A TOTAL LOSS AND TOOK OWNERSHIP OF IT. A GASOLINE CAR ACCELERATE BY OPENING THE THROTTLE TO ALLOW MORE AIR INTO THE ENGINE. THE ELECTRONIC THROTTLE SUDDENLY OPEN DUE TO THE PHYSICAL ELECTRONICS AND/OR SOFTWARE CONTROLLING IT WHEN THE TRANSMISSION IS SHIFT BETWEEN REVERSE AND DRIVE. DR. RONALD A. BELT THEORY SEEMS PLAUSIBLE. IF TRUE YOU WOULD THINK JUST CHANGING THE SOFTWARE TO GET AN AVERAGE OF VOLTAGE SAMPLES WOULD PREVENT THE OVER COMPENSATION OF THE ECU THROTTLE CONTROLLER CAUSE BY LOW VOLTAGE SPIKES. HTTPS://WWW.AUTOSAFETY.ORG/DR-RONALD-A-BELTS-SUDDEN-ACCELERATION-PAPERS/

"TAKATA RECALL" -  I RECEIVED INFORMATION FROM LEXUS IN EARLY 2017 STATING THAT MY VEHICLE WAS PART OF A RECALL DUE TO FAULTY TAKATA INFLATORS.  THE STATEMENT SHOWED THAT MY VEHICLES AIRBAG REPLACEMENT DUE TO THE RECALL COULD BE DELAYED BECAUSE THE AIRBAGS WERE PUT INTO CATEGORIES BASED ON THE AGE OF THE VEHICLE AND STATING THE CHANCE OF DEGRADATION BY WHERE YOU LIVED.  THE INFO STATED THEY WOULD BE IN TOUCH WITH ME AT A LATER DATE WHEN MY VEHICLE WAS CONSIDERED TO BE MORE AT RISK.  THIS WAS SEVERAL MONTHS AGO, I NOW LIVE IN FLORIDA WHERE IT IS VERY HOT, AND SINCE MY VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN RECALLED AN TAKEN INTO THE DEALER FOR ASSESSMENT AND/OR REPAIR, I CANNOT REGISTER IT FOR THE CLASS ACTION SETTLEMENT.  ANY HELP IN THIS MATTER WOULD BE APPRECIATED.

TAKATA RECALL. WE RECEIVED A RECALL FOR THIS AIRBAG ON MAY 2016. FAST FORWARD TO MARCH 2017 AND A REMEDY FOR THIS RECALL IS FINALLY AVAILABLE!! WHEN I CALLED MY AUTHORIZED LEXUS DEALER IN CONCORD, CA I WAS TOLD THAT I'LL BE PUT ON A WAITING LIST  UNTIL THE PARTS ARE AVAILABLE. I WAS TOLD IT COULD TAKE 2-3 WEEKS. WHAT'S THE POINT OF ADVISING THEIR CUSTOMERS THAT A REMEDY IS AVAILABLE IF THE DEALERSHIP IS NOT PREPARED TO FIX THE ISSUE WHEN WE'VE BEEN WAITING ALMOST A YEAR FOR A RESOLUTION!!

TAKATA RECALL THE LOCAL LEXUS DEALER AND CAR MAKER, LEXUS AUTOMOBILES, ARE TAKING AN UNACCEPTABLY LONG TIME TO REMEDY THIS LIFE-THREATENING DEFECT. THIS WEEK I HAVE RECEIVED A LETTER FROM THE CAR MAKER WITH A WARNING TO NOT LET ANYONE SIT IN THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT WHEN THE CAR IS BEING OPERATED. THIS IS THE SECOND MAILING I HAVE RECEIVED, AND THE PROBLEM IS DESCRIBED AS MORE CRITICAL WITH EACH MAILING. SINCE JUNE OF 2016 I HAVE BEEN ON A WAITING LIST WITH THE LOCAL DEALER TO HAVE THE TAKATA DEVICE REPLACED. THIS DELAY IS NOT A REASONABLE PERIOD TO WAIT. FURTHERMORE THE LOCAL DEALER, LEXUS OF THOUSAND OAKS, IS NOT DILIGENT IN ASSIGNING PEOPLE TO THE RECALL REPAIR WAITING LIST. MY WIFE CALLED THE DEALER TWICE IN EARLY 2016 AND WAS ASSURED THAT OUR CAR WAS ASSIGNED. I VISITED THE DEALER IN SUMMER OF 2016 AND FOUND THAT OUR CAR WAS NOT ON THE  DEALER RECALL REPAIR LIST. SO, ONLY BY VISITING THE DEALER WAS I ABLE TO DEFINITELY BE ASSIGNED TO THE LIST. VERY POOR OVERSIGHT BY THE CAR MAKER OF A CRITICAL ISSUE BEING HANDLED BY THE DEALER. THE CAR MAKER SHOULD STEP-UP AND CREATE A WAITING LIST WEBSITE THAT SCHEDULES APPOINTMENTS AT ANY LOCAL DEALER THAT IS READY TO REPAIR. SOME FAIR METHOD OF ASSIGNING PRIORITIES SHOULD BE CLEARLY PUBLICIZED FOR ALL CAR OWNERS AFFECTED. THE CAR MAKER HAS TO BE MORE INVOLVED WITH THIS RECALL EFFORT AND TAKE THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITY AWAY FROM THE DEALER. VERY, VERY DISAPPOINTING TO SAY THE LEAST.
RECALL FIX HAS TAKEN OVER 1 YEAR AND STILL DOES NOT HAVE A ESTIMATED COMPLETION DATE

I'VE CONTACTED MY DEALERSHIP, FREEMAN LEXUS, NUMEROUS TIMES SINCE HEARING ABOUT THE TAKATA RECALL IN JUNE OF LAST YEAR. 9 MONTHS LATER I AM STILL AWAITING REPAIR. THE FIRST 5 TIMES I CALLED, I WAS TOLD TO CALL BACK AND CHECK IN TO SEE IF THE AIRBAG REPLACEMENT PARTS WHERE IN. BASED ON THE PROJECTED DEGRADATION TIMELINE OF 6-9 YEARS, SEPTEMBER OF 2016 PUT MY AT 9 YEARS. I AM NOT SATISFIED WITH LEXUS LACK OF TIMELY REPAIR.

I RECEIVED THE 9 YEAR EXTENDED WARRANTY FOR CARBON BUILDUP, BUT IT ONLY COVERS ME THROUGH 3/8/17.  IF I HAVE CARBON BUILDUP AGAIN AFTER THAT, IT WILL COST ME $2,000-$3,000 TO FIX. THIS IS IN REGARDS TO MY 2008 LEXUS IS 250 INTERIOR PANELS STICKING/MELTING WITH POOR APPEARANCE AND ITS DETERIORATING WHICH CAN AFFECT MY SAFETY AS IT WILL REDUCE MY DRIVING VISIBILITY.  I HAVE VISITED THE FOLLOWING DEALERSHIPS:  LEXUS OF NORTH MIAMI, JM LEXUS AND LEXUS OF WEST KENDALL.   ON MANY OCCASIONS, I HAVE POINTED OUT THE PROBLEMS WITH MY DASHBOARD AND SIDE DOORS TO SEVERAL DIFFERENT SERVICE ADVISORS.  I MENTIONED THE ISSUES I HAD WITH MY DASHBOARD AND DOOR BUT THEY ALL JUST BLEW IT OFF AND STATED THAT THERE WAS NO PROBLEM WITH IT.  THEY ALL SAID IT WAS JUST BASIC NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR DUE TO THE FLORIDA HEAT.   THE AREAS THAT ARE AFFECTED ARE THE DASHBOARD, DRIVER AND PASSENGER SIDE DOOR PANELS AND REAR DOOR PANELS.  IT IS STICKY, MELTING, DEGRADING, LEAVES PRINTS ON YOUR HANDS AND FINGERS WHEN TOUCHED. IN ADDITION, IT LEAVES A BLACK RESIDUE ON YOUR CLOTHES WHEN YOU ACCIDENTLY BUMP INTO IT.  I KNOW THAT LEXUS IS A BRAND THAT PRIDES ITSELF ON PURSUIT OF PERFECTION' BUT I DON'T SEE THAT PRIDE FROM ANY OF THE DEALERSHIPS TO RESOLVE THIS ISSUE.  IT'S ABSURD HOW THE SERVICE ADVISOR CAN TELL ME IT'S DUE TO THE FLORIDAS HEAT AND ALSO THE BASIC WEAR AND TEAR AS I HAVE AN OLDER MODEL HONDA ACCORD AND THE DASHBOARD AND DOOR PANELS ARE NOT DETERIORATING.   I PURCHASED A LEXUS (IS250) BECAUSE I LOVED THE STYLE AND ITS RELIABILITY.  MY CAR STILL HAS ITS SHINE AND DOES NOT HAVE ANY MAJOR DENTS.  I TAKE PRIDE IN TAKING CARE OF MY INVESTMENT.  THE EXTERIOR IS IN IMMACULATE CONDITION AND SO IS THE INTERIOR EXCEPT FOR THE DETERIORATING DASHBOARD PANELS AND DOORS.  I WOULD UNDERSTAND THERE WOULD BE BASIC WEAR AND TEAR IF MY CAR WAS OLDER THAN 10 YEARS, BUT WE ARE TALKING ABOUT A LUXURY CAR WHICH SHOULD BE USING TOP QUALITY MATERIAL.   IN ADDITION, THE ISSUE STARTED 2.5 YEARS AFTER I PURCHASED IT NEW, WHICH ALL THE DEALERSHIPS DISREGARDED MY COMPLAINTS.   *TR

MY MAIN CONCERN IS THAT THE HID HEADLIGHTS WILL NOT WORK. INITIALLY THE PROBLEM BEGAN ON THE PASSENGER SIDE HEADLIGHT. THEN I RESEARCHED THE PROBLEM AND DISCOVERED IT IS ACTUALLY EXTREMELY COMMON ONLINE. IN MY AREA MANY LEXUS CARS FROM IS250 TO GS HAVE THE SIMILAR PROBLEM. THE SITUATION ESCALATED WHEN MY DRIVER'S SIDE HEADLIGHT STOPPED LIGHTING ALSO. THIS REALLY IS UNSETTLING BECAUSE I NOW HAVE EXTREMELY LOW VISIBILITY AT NIGHT AND IN ADDITION I COMMUTE TO SCHOOL THROUGH A DARK UNLIGHTED CORNER THAT COULD LEAD TO A CRASH IF THE OTHER CAR DOES NOT SEE ME. I DID CONTACT LEXUS BUT THEIR RESOLUTION SEEMS RATHER FOUL PLAY. MOST OF THEIR IS250 AND GS HAVE THE PROBLEM BUT THEY WOULD FIX IT ONLY FOR ABOUT 1,000 DOLLARS PER HEADLIGHT. I AND MULTIPLE OTHER CONSUMERS ARE NOT JUST GOING TO PAY FOR THE HIGH PRICE FOR SOMETHING CLEARLY AT LEXUS'S FAULT. ALONG WITH THE HEADLIGHTS MY SUSPENSION SEEM INCREASINGLY LOUD AND SQUEAKY WHEN I MAKE A TURN. IT IS A LUXURY CAR AND BEING IT I BELIEVE THE PROBLEM SHOULD NOT HAVE OCCURRED. IT SHOULD BE RATHER QUIET. I TRULY, AM A DISPLEASED CUSTOMER AND I FEEL THAT LEXUS IS VERY UNRESPONSIVE TOWARD THEIR PROBLEMS.  *TR

WHEN COMING TO A STOP OR WHEN AT A STOP, MY CAR WOULD SHAKE VERY HARD AS IF IT WAS GOING TO TURN OFF. FORTUNATELY, IT NEVER HAS. I WOULD HAVE TO PUT THE CAR INTO NEUTRAL TO STOP THE SHAKING OR IT WOULD STOP ON IT'S OWN AFTER 10-15 SECONDS. DURING THIS TIME, NO LIGHTS HAVE EVER TURNED ON TO INDICATE THERE WAS A PROBLEM. THE FIRST TIME THIS HAPPENED WAS IN LATE JULY 2009/ EARLY AUGUST 2009 AND EVER SINCE THEN, IT WOULD HAPPEN AT LEAST 2 TIMES A DAY. MY CAR HAS BEEN IN THE SHOP MULTIPLE TIMES FOR THIS ISSUE.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 LEXUS IS-F. THE VEHICLE ACCELERATED AND CRASHED INTO A GARAGE DOOR AT A LOCAL SHOP. WHEN THE CONTACT ATTEMPTED TO ENGAGE THE BRAKE PEDAL TO STOP THE VEHICLE THE BRAKES WERE LOCKED. THE CONTACT WAS FORCED TO SHIFT INTO NEUTRAL GEAR TO STOP THE VEHICLE. THE CONTACT CALLED THE MANUFACTURER REGARDING THIS VEHICLE AND THEY HAD THE VEHICLE TOWED TO A DEALER TO  DIAGNOSE THE FAILURE. THE CONTACT HAS REQUESTED THAT THE MANUFACTURER BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE REPAIRS OF THE VEHICLE AND THE GARAGE DOOR. THE  FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 8900.

IN EARLY 02/09 I WAS DRIVING HOME ON INTERSTATE 695 N IN MARYLAND.  I WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 50 MPH, WHEN ALL OF A SUDDEN THE CAR SUDDENLY ACCELERATED TO ABOUT 95 MPH THROUGH NO EFFORT OF MY OWN. I DID NOT ENGAGE THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL TO INCREASE THE SPEED OF THE VEHICLE. I IMMEDIATELY ENGAGED THE FOOT BRAKE TO DECELERATE AND BUT THE CAR WOULD NOT SLOW. EVENTUALLY AFTER SEVERAL ATTEMPTS I WAS ABLE TO SLOW THE CAR WITH THE BRAKE BUT THE ENGINE CONTINUED TO VIOLENTLY REV. AS I RELEASED THE FOOT BRAKE, THE CAR ONCE AGAIN ACCELERATED WITHOUT ENGAGING THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL. EVEN AFTER ENGAGING THE EMERGENCY BRAKE, THE UNAIDED ACCELERATION AND MY ATTEMPT TO DECELERATE THE CAR CONTINUED. I WAS FINALLY ABLE TO SLOW THE CAR ENOUGH TO PULL OUT OF TRAFFIC AND OVER TO THE EMERGENCY LANE AND EVENTUALLY STOP THE MOTION OF THE VEHICLE. ALTHOUGH I WAS ABLE TO BRING THE CAR TO A STOP, THE ENGINE CONTINUED TO REV VIOLENTLY, THE BACK TIRES SPUN OUT OF CONTROL AND THE BACK OF THE CAR STARTED TO FISH TAIL. I TRIED A NUMBER OF DIFFERENT TACTICS TO STOP THE CAR COMPLETELY INCLUDING, ATTEMPTING TO MANUALLY SHIFT GEARS, PUTTING THE CAR IN NEUTRAL ETC. FINALLY, AFTER SEVERAL MINUTES I WAS ABLE TO TURN OFF THE IGNITION AND BRING THE CAR TO A COMPLETE STOP AND THE ORDEAL CAME TO AN END WITHOUT DAMAGING THE CAR AND MORE IMPORTANTLY WITHOUT INJURY TO ME OR OTHERS.  I HAD THE CAR TOWED TO DEALERSHIP THAT NIGHT AND EXPLAINED THE SITUATION TO THE SERVICE ORGANIZATION THE FOLLOWING DAY. THE SERVICE TEAM CONDUCTED MULTIPLE DIAGNOSTIC TESTS BUT WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE OR EXPLAIN THE CAUSE OF THE UNINTENDED ACCELERATION TO MY SATISFACTION. ONE SERVICE REP SUGGESTED THAT THE FLOOR MAT WAS THE CAUSE BUT I HAD CHECKED IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ORDEAL THE NIGHT BEFORE TO ENSURE THAT THE FLOOR MAT HAD NOT BECOME LODGED UNDER THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL. SINCE THE DEALERSHIP WAS NOT ABLE TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM, I DECIDED THAT THE BEST COURSE OF ACTION WAS TO  RETURN THE CAR AND LEASE ANOTHER CAR. *TR

I PURCHASED 2 BRAND NEW MICHELIN PILOT SPORT A/S PLUS 225/45/ZR17 91Y FOR MY 2008 LEXUS IS 250 INSTALLED AS FRONT TIRES AT COSTCO. BEFORE LESS THAN 24 HOURS OF INSTALLED, AND LESS THAN 15 MILES OF USE, ONE OF THEM LOOSE THE AIR PRESSURE, THE TPMS ALERT ME OF LOW TIRE, I STOP AT NEAREST GAS STATION (ABOUT 2 MILES FROM THE MOMENT OF THE TPMS ALERT) AND IN EFFECT THE LEFT FRONT TIRE WAS LOW, I START TO INFLATE THE TIRE AND BEFORE THE TIRE WAS COMPLETELY INFLATED, A BLOWOUT OCCURRED CAUSING AN INJURY IN MY FACE. *TR

I AM WRITING TO REPORT A BRAKE FAILURE ON MY NEW LEXUS IS 350 WHILE PARALLEL PARKING.  I BACKED MY CAR INTO THE SPACE, AND THEN TOUCHED THE GAS LIGHTLY TO MOVE IT FORWARD TO CLOSE THE 4 TO 5 FOOT GAP.  I PUT FOOT ON BRAKE AND PUSHED DOWN.  BRAKE WENT DOWN CLOSE TO FLOOR AND DID NOT STOP CAR.  IT KEPT MOVING SLOWLY FORWARD AND BUMPED INTO VEHICLE PARKED AHEAD OF ME, SCRATCHING BOTH IT AND MY CAR.  WITH CAR IN NEUTRAL I PUSHED DOWN THE BRAKE PEDAL TWICE MORE AND IT WELT CLOSE TO FLOOR.  ON THIRD ATTEMPT IT CAME BACK TO NORMAL.  I LEFT NOTE FOR OWNER OF CAR AHEAD OF ME AND TOOK CAR TO LEXUS OF PLEASANTON.  THEY KEPT CAR FOR 2 DAYS BUT SAY THAT THEY CAN'T DUPLICATE PROBLEM AND THAT IT IS SAFE.  A QUICK GOOGLE SEARCH OF "LEXUS BRAKE FAILURE" DEMONSTRATES OTHER SIMILAR PROBLEMS WITH OTHER LEXUS CARS.  LEXUS REFUSES TO ACKNOWLEDGE THIS PROBLEM OR DEAL WITH.  THEY SAY THAT IF THEY CAN'T DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM THEY DON'T BELIEVE IT EXISTS.  A FRIEND OF MY WIFE SAYS HER LEXUS DID THE SAME THING BUT LEXUS TOLD HER THAT NOTHING IS WRONG WITH IT.  LEXUS HAS A PROBLEM WITH ITS ABS BRAKING SYSTEM , BUT IS STONEWALLING THE PROBLEM.  SOONER OR LATER SOMEONE WILL BE SERIOUSLY INJURED OR KILLED BECAUSE OF LEXUS FAILURE TO ACKNOWLEDGE THIS PROBLEM. *TR
